contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians --> | name = DJ Olive | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | landscape = Yes | birth_name = Gregor Asch | alias = The Audio Janitor | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Williamsburg, Brooklyn]], [[New York City, New York]] | instrument = [[Turntables]] | genre = [[Hip-hop music|Hip-hop]], [[instrumental hip hop]], [[turntablism]], [[ambient music|ambient]], [[illbient]], [[electronic music|electronic]], [[acid jazz]], [[nu-jazz]], [[jazz music|jazz]], [[free improvisation]], [[experimental music|experimental]], [[avant-garde music|avant-garde]] | occupation = [[Disc jockey]], [[Record producer|producer]], [[turntablist]], [[rapper]] | years_active = Early 1990's (with [[We (group)|We]]), 2003-Present (as DJ Olive) | label = [[Asphodel Records]], The Agriculture, Room40, [[Sub Rosa (label)|Sub Rosa]], SYR Records | associated_acts = [[We (group)|We]], Rich Panciera (aka Lloop), Ignacio Platas (aka Once 11 and Nacho), Lunchbox, Liminal | notable_instruments = [[Turntables]] }} '''DJ Olive''' (also known as '''The Audio Janitor'''; born '''Gregor Asch''') is an [[United States|American]] [[disc jockey]] and [[turntablist]]. He is known for producing music generally in the [[illbient]] genre, with strong influences of [[jazz music|jazz]], and [[free improvisation]] styles. DJ Olive is a member of [[We (group)|We]], Lunchbox and Liminal. He has also collaborated with [[Kim Gordon]], [[Ikue Mori]], [[William Hooker (musician)|William Hooker]], [[Zeena Parkins]], [[Uri Caine]], [[Medeski Martin and Wood]], [[Dave Douglas (trumpeter)|Dave Douglas]], and various others. ==Associated acts== *[[Kim Gordon]] ([[Sonic Youth]], [[Ciccone Youth]], [[Free Kitten]]) *[[Ikue Mori]] ([[DNA (No Wave band)|DNA]], [[Kato Hideki]], [[Ground Zero (band)|Ground Zero]], [[Fred Frith]], [[Henry Cow]], [[Death Ambient]], [[Butch Morris]], [[Hemophiliac (band)|Hemophiliac]], [[John Zorn]], [[Mike Patton]], [[Electric Masada]], Phantom Orchard, Jim Denley, Rik Rue, [[Amanda Stewart]]) *[[Zeena Parkins]] ([[News from Babel]], [[Skeleton Crew (band)|Skeleton Crew]], [[Keep the Dog]], [[Cosa Brava]]) *[[Uri Caine]] (Rochester-[[Gerald Veasley]] band, Uri Caine Bedrock 3 (also toured with), [[Mickey Katz]], [[Don Byron]], [[Ahmir "Questlove" Thompson]], [[The Roots]], [[Christian McBride]], [[Aaron Levinson]], [[Pat Martino]], [[Los Angeles Chamber Orchestra]], [[Paolo Fresu]], [[Theo Bleckmann]]) *[[Medeski Martin and Wood]] ([[John Scofield]], [[Bob Moses (musician)|Bob Moses]], [[Phish]], [[North Mississippi Allstars]], [[Robert Randolph]], [[The Wood Brothers]]) *[[Dave Douglas (trumpeter)|Dave Douglas]] ([[Cuong Vu]], [[Anthony Coleman]], [[Trisha Brown|Trisha Brown Dance Company]], [[Bill Frisell]], Keystone, [[Roscoe 'Fatty' Arbuckle]], Brass Ecstasy band, [[Vincent Chancey]], [[Luis Bonilla]], [[Marcus Rojas]], [[Nasheet Waits]], [[Jim McNeely]], Frankfurt Radio Bigband, various others) *[[William Hooker (musician)|William Hooker]] ([[Thurston Moore]], [[Elliott Sharp]]) ==Discography== '''Studio Albums''' *''Bodega'' (The Agriculture, 2003)[http://www.theagriculture.com/djolive.html] *''Buoy'' (Room40, 2004)[http://www.room40.org/releases-buoy.shtml] *''Sleep'' (Room40, 2006)[http://www.room40.org/releases-sleep.shtml] '''Collaborations''' With J.P. Dessy *''Scories'' ([[Sub Rosa]], 2005) [http://www.subrosa.net/index_fr.htm] With [[Ikue Mori]] and [[Kim Gordon]] *''SYR 5'' (SYR Records, 2000)[http://www.smellslikerecords.com/sonicyouth/7.php?cat_no=syr005] '''Live Albums''' *''Heaps As, Live in Tasmania'' (The Agriculture, 2006)[http://www.theagriculture.com/djolive.html] *''DJ Olive meets I/O3: Powerhouse Sessions'' (Room40, 2002)[http://www.room40.org/releases-djolive.shtml] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.djolive.com Official Site] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Gregor Asch | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Dj Olive | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Williamsburg, Brooklyn]], [[New York City, New York]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dj Olive}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American DJs]] [[Category:Illbient]]
